action.action-desc: Mr. Mullin introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Transportation to make grants for the deployment of innovative real-time transcription and translation technology to improve the transit rider experience for deaf, hard of hearing, and limited English proficient individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transit Captions Innovations Act.
Section 5312(e)(3) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (B), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (C), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: the deployment of real-time transcription and translation technology to improve the rider experience for deaf, hard of hearing, and limited English proficient individuals.

section.text: Section 5338(a)(2)(G) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (i), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (ii), by inserting and at the end; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: $4,000,000 for fiscal year 2027, $4,100,000 for fiscal year 2028, $4,202,500 for fiscal year 2029, $4,307,562 for fiscal year 2030, and $4,415,251 for fiscal year 2031 shall be available to carry out projects eligible under section 5312(e)(3)(D);
